block.p: Margaret Graham Brennan and William Lyman Cobb Jr. were married yesterday at St. John's of Lattingtown Episcopal Church in Locust Valley, N.Y. The Rev. Paul Gilbert performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Cobb was until earlier this year a vice president and the senior government bond trader in the investment management division of J. P. Morgan & Company in New York, from which the bridegroom retired as a vice chairman.
Margaret Graham Brennan and William Lyman Cobb Jr. were married yesterday at St. John's of Lattingtown Episcopal Church in Locust Valley, N.Y. The Rev. Paul Gilbert performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Cobb was until earlier this year a vice president and the senior government bond trader in the investment management division of J. P. Morgan & Company in New York, from which the bridegroom retired as a vice chairman.
The bride graduated from Wheaton College, and is a daughter of Margaret Doig Brennan of Old Westbury, N.Y., and the late James A. Brennan.

Mr. Cobb is now an executive vice president and the chief investment officer of the Church Pension Fund, an Episcopal agency in New York. He graduated from Northwestern University and received an M.B.A. from the University of Chicago.
The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
